p: Even more severely, cost minimization and profit maximization for the manufacturing companies and the pressure from customers ever yearning for lower prices lead to the search for manufacturers that offer their products for lower and lower costs. As a result of this rush to the bottom, many companies outsourced production to other parts of the world with lower wages and lower, if not lax, environmental standards. Consequently, if one pharmaceutical company cannot provide a drug due to production problems of a key compound in a chemical plant, then all the others cannot either. They all use just this one company for the specific compound because it is the cheapest provider. Furthermore, pharmaceutical companies also outsourced essential expert knowledge. Johnson & Johnson was the last major drug company to stop R&D on antibiotics last fall; others had stopped years ago. 2
